Name: Lets Encrypt - Route53
Description:
Request (or renew) a X.509 SSL Certificate from the [Let's Encrypt Certificate Authority](https://letsencrypt.org/). 

#### Features

- ACME v2 protocol support which allows generating wildcard certificates (*.example.com)
- [AWS Route53](https://aws.amazon.com/route53/) Challenge for TLD, CNAME and Wildcard domains. 
- Publishes/Updates SSL Certificates in the [Octopus Deploy Certificate Store](https://octopus.com/docs/deployment-examples/certificates). 
- Verified to work on both Windows (PowerShell 5+) and Linux (PowerShell 6+) deployment Targets or Workers.

Parameters.Name: LE_Route53_CertificateDomain
Parameters.Label: Certificate Domain
Parameters.HelpText: Domain (TLD, CNAME or Wildcard) to create a certificate for.

Parameters.Name: LE_Route53_PfxPassword
Parameters.Label: PFX Password
Parameters.HelpText: Password to use when converting to / from PFX.

Parameters.Name: LE_Route53_ReplaceIfExpiresInDays
Parameters.Label: Replace expiring certificate before N days
Parameters.HelpText: Replace the certificate if it expiries within N days

Parameters.Name: LE_Route53_AWSAccount
Parameters.Label: AWS account
Parameters.HelpText: An AWS Account that has API access to make Route53 changes.

Parameters.Name: LE_Route53_Octopus_APIKey
Parameters.Label: Octopus Deploy API key
Parameters.HelpText: A Octopus Deploy API key with access to change Certificates in the Certificate Store.

Parameters.Name: LE_Route53_Use_Staging
Parameters.Label: Use Lets Encrypt Staging
Parameters.HelpText: Should the Certificate be generated using the Lets Encrypt Staging infrastructure?

Parameters.Name: LE_Route53_CreateWildcardSAN
Parameters.Label: Create Wildcard SAN
Parameters.HelpText:
Should the certificate have a Subject Alternative Name (SAN) excluding the wildcard?

e.g. a certificate domain of `*.internal.example-domain.com` could also have a SAN of `internal.example-domain.com`
